result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Policarpio Villanueva

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Motion hearing on November 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 11:25am 
Defendant Policarpio Villanueva in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that Mr. Villanueva has just provided him with some status updates; there is a plea offer- a PSI would be involved.
Attorney Huebner raises that the Defense is requesting modification of Bond. 
The Court requires Attorney Huebner to file the Bond-motion by the end of this week 
recess 11:28am 

NEXT:  Motion Hearing (on Defense forthcoming bond-motion) on November 10th at 11:00am [this hearing may also include a Plea Hearing and PSI request]
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 9:38am. 
Defendant Policarpio Villanueva in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner.  ADA Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that he is currently court-appointed counsel, however he anticipates that he will be appointed as counsel by the Public Defender. 
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Huebner intends to meet with Mr. Villanueva this coming week. Attorney Huebner requests the scheduling of another status conference.  
recess 9:40am

NEXT:  Status Conference on November 1st at 11:00am
Court's Response to Defendant's 10/3/22 Letter

Order for Appointment of an Attorney

The Court orders repayment at the rate of $50/month until the total sum is paid; beginning 11/15/2022  or as soon thereafter as the person's economic circumstances allow & payments shall be made to the Clerk of Courts by the 1st of every month thereafter. 
Ec/pc: DA, Atty Huebner , Def (10/5/22--ma)
Letter from defendant re case
Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 10:41am
Defendant Policarpio Villanueva in court, in custody.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews submission from SPD office.
Upon agreement of Parties, the Court adjourns to allow counsel to be appointed to Mr. Villanueva's case. 
recess: 10:43am

NEXT: Status on 10/13/22 at 9:30am (status of counsel?)
Status of Counsel
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 2:08PM
Defendant Policarpio Villanueva in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies Victim Rights Compliance.
Att de La Rosa advises that negations are continuing, and that another Status would be appropriate. Att De La Rosa states that projected disposition may be known at the next hearing.

The Defendant makes a statement requesting a new attorney appointment. The Court discharges Att De La Rosa from the file, and directs the Public Defender's Office to appoint another attorney for the Defendant.
The Defendant advises that he intends on retaining private counsel, but agrees that an appointment of another Public Defender makes sense for the time being.

recess 2:15PM

NEXT: 
(1) Clerk - Please remove Att De La Rosa's appointment from this file
(2) Status Conference on 09/16 at 10:30AM
Transcript from 6/3/2022 preliminary hearing

Pre-trial conference on August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[Court Reporter: Lisa Kwasigroch]
[ma] Case called at 11:13 AM 
Defendant Policarpio Villanueva in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   Krysta Parson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 11:19am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/3/22 at 10:00am     (2) Status Conference on 8/19/22 at 2:00pm
Arraignment on July 5, 2022 at 11:15 am.

08:42 AM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Policarpio Villanueva in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Defendant Policarpio Villanueva in custody.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Officer K. Miller sworn and testifies:
-  Direct examination by ADA Beck
-  Cross examination by Atty. De La Rosa
-  Redirect examination by ADA Beck

Arguments presented by Counsel. 
Atty. De La Rosa foreshadows potential challenges depending on future charging. 
Court finds probable cause that the Defendant committed a felony.  Court binds the Defendant over for trial.
Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Case continued for ARGN on 7/5/22 at 11:15am
Recess 9:04am

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
ARGN on 7/5/22 at 11:15am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa
Preliminary hearing on June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am. {Hearing date/time is different than what was provided in court due to a change in the Court's calendar; new date coordinated with counsel. -AR}

[MK] case called at 9:08am 
Defendant Policarpio Villanueva in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he can be listed as counsel of record for Mr. Villanueva; the Order Appointing Counsel will be filed in the next few days. 
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today and the State's officer-witness was present, however the Defense needs more time to prepare for hearing.  
recess 9:10am 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on May 17th at 8:30am
Letter Judge re Prelim convert to Status
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Conditions of this Bond include:
--no acts or threats of violence
--maintain absolute sobriety

[ml] Case called at 1:33PM
Defendant Policarpio Villanueva appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Shock verifies Victim Rights Compliance.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit.

ADA Shock advises that the Defendant is currently on a PO hold at the jail, and will likely remain there for some time. Att Nelson echos this, stating that a revocation hearing is scheduled for the Defendant sometime next month.

The Court requires a $5,000.00 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--maintain absolute sobriety

recess 1:43PM

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 03/25 at 9:00AM
